Name: Burpee's Peppy Hybrid
Characteristics: F1 hybrid, early, two or three ears per stalk, white pointed and hulless kernels.

Name: Carnival
Characteristics: early, kernels pink, red, black, white, and yellow of good popping quality.
Adaptation: northern United States. N.H. Agr. Expt. Sta. Bul. 380:19. 1950.

Name: Eastern Sunburst
Breeder: Eastern States Farmers' Exchange, West Springfield, Mass.
Vendor: Eastern States Farmers' Exchange, West Springfield, Mass.
Parentage: cross of Yellow Pearl types from two sources.

Name: Fireside
Breeder: New Hampshire Agr. Expt. Sta., Durham, N.H.
Characteristics: early, dwarf plants, with two mahogany red or golden ears.

Name: Popinjay
Characteristics: early, with variegated pink, black, and white kernels of good popping quality.
Adaptation: northern United States. N.H. Agr. Expt. Sta. Bul. 380:18. 1950.
